reasons_to_visit.details: February offers the most genuine local experience with minimal tourist crowds, perfect for experiencing authentic Czech culture.
Perfect time to visit the East Bohemian Museum, Klicper Theatre, and warm cafés while enjoying traditional Czech winter atmosphere.
Snow-covered historic architecture, especially the White Tower and Holy Spirit Cathedral, creates stunning winter photography opportunities.
Lowest accommodation and dining prices of the year, making luxury experiences more affordable than peak season.
University district hosts winter cultural events, academic conferences, and student performances during the academic year.

reasons_to_avoid.details: February can be the coldest month with temperatures often below freezing (-3 to 4°C) and potential for snow and ice.
Short winter days with only 9-10 hours of daylight, limiting outdoor sightseeing opportunities.
Overcast skies and limited sunshine can create a somber atmosphere, though this adds to the authentic winter experience.
Some outdoor attractions may have limited hours or be weather-dependent during the coldest winter period.

activities: Indoor museum visits at East Bohemian Museum
Cozy café culture in Great Square
